titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Elaine Barkin Musical Compositions and Papers PASC-M.0059
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Melissa Haley, 2015, Caroline Cubé.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-12-20 11:37:41 -0800.

did.unittitle: Elaine Barkin musical compositions and papers
did.abstract: This collection primarily contains musical compositions and professional writings by composer Elaine Barkin.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Reproduction and Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Elaine Barkin Musical Compositions and Papers (Collection PASC-M 59). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Composer, writer, and performer Elaine Barkin was born December 15, 1932 in New York City. She graduated from Queens College, CUNY and Brandeis University (MFA, 1954 and Ph.D, 1971) and studied composition at the Berlin Hochschule für Musik in the 1950s. Barkin taught at Queens College (1964-1970), the University of Michigan (1970-1974), and Princeton (1974), before joining the faculty at UCLA in 1974, teaching music composition and theory; she retired from UCLA in 1997. Barkin also served as an editor for the journal Perspectives of New Music from the mid-1960s to 1980s, and wrote numerous essays for the publication and other music journals, including Open Space Magazine, which she co-founded. In the 1980s, Barkin undertook several excursions to Bali to study gamelan music and interview Indonesian musicians.
Elaine Barkin has composed numerous musical works, including those for strings, piano, percussion, harp, woodwind, horns, gamelan, and voice.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of draft and reproduction scores, sketches, and some completed versions of Elaine Barkin's musical compositions; writings and material relating to editorial work for the journal Perspectives of New Music; and writings for other publications. Also present is a small amount of material concerning Barkin's other professional endeavors, including her involvement with the Society for Music Theory and her interest in Balinese music; personal correspondence; ephemera; and audio recordings of some of her works.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
This collection is arranged into the following series:
Series 1. Musical compositions
Series 2. Perspectives of New Music
Series 3. Other writings and professional endeavors
Series 4. Personal correspondence and files
Series 5. Audio recordings
Series 6. Film: Lapis

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: UCLA Music Library has individual scores and recordings of Barkin's work. Please search the UCLA Library Catalog.

controlaccess.subject: Universities and colleges -- California -- Los Angeles -- Faculty -- Archives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series consists of draft and reproduction scores, sketches, and some completed versions of Barkin's compositions, arranged alphabetically by title. Material for a few titles includes related correspondence, notes, performance graphics and photographs.

did.unittitle: 18 Easy and Moderately Difficult Pieces for Pedal and/or Lever Harp

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Material includes performance photographs and props (Box 11).

did.unittitle: Duo for Two Violins and Three Little Duos

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Material includes clippings and notes (Box 12).

did.unittitle: Play and Ghost Sarabande for violoncello
Plus Ça Change [La Même Plus Changé]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Includes [Interlude] (1974) and [Strings?] (2001-2002) [Box 13], and a sketch for a piece on solitude never composed (1983) [Box 9].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Includes Anne LeBaron's Solar Music, and Renee T. Coulombe's Four (and...) for Solo Piano, Triage I for Seven Performers, and Triage II: A Map of the Known Universe for Seven Performers. Also present are additional scores submitted by various composers to Perspectives of New Music for their tribute issue to Aaron Copland (see Box 17, folders 7-8 for related material).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Barkin wrote numerous essays for Perspectives of New Music and also served as an editor for the journal from the mid-1960s to the 1980s. This series consists of her PNM writings and of correspondence related to her editorial work, in addition to production material for a few individual issues. Writings for other journals and publications are located in Series 3.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Contains drafts, corrected proofs and notes for Barkin's essays and other works for PNM. Titles are arranged chronologically.

did.unittitle: Review of Charles Rosen's Arnold Schoenberg
Post Impressions: Arthur Berger's Trio, and a Postlude
A Dedication, Five ADmusements, & A Digression
Responses from Women Composers in the US
either/other (concerning the work of Susan McClary)
reexperiencing Language, as a Music revisited
9 Ben-Collages & VI Fragments from a Never-Ending Work in Progress for the Ben Boretz Festschrift

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Correspondence received also contain some copies of outgoing letters by Barkin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Bulk is letters received by PNM; also includes letters sent to Barkin by PNM, mostly about her writings for the journal.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Notes, correspondence, and other material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Correspondence and scores from composers for a tribute issue to Aaron Copland.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Annotated published edition; contains Barkin's piece Play it AS it lays.

did.unittitle: Series 3. Other writings and professional endeavors

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Series consists of Barkin's writings for other journals and publications, biographical entries for the Grove Dictionary of Music, and her dissertation. Also present is material related to Barkin's editorial work for the anthology Audible Traces: Gender, Identity, & Music; newsletters and other items for several music organizations including the Society for Music Theory; material concerning Barkin's interest in Balinese music; items related to her recordings and music publication; images of an art project; and several folders of ephemera that document Barkin's performances and professional activities.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Contains drafts, corrected proofs, notes, and scores for writings, some with related correspondence. Also included are biographical entries written for various editions of the Grove Dictionary of Music, and Barkin's dissertation Pitch-time Structure in Arnold Schoenberg's Opus 23, No. 1: A Contribution Toward A Theory of Nontonal Music.

did.unittitle: Analysis Symposium: Webern's Orchestra Piece Bewegt
Analysis Symposium: Debussy's Pour Les Sixtes: Notes in Progress (3 fols)
Rhetorical Variations: The Composer in Society
A Text on the Music of Harry Partch
Conjunctions, Affinities, and Loose Ends: A Text in Five Parts for G.E.M.S.
e: an anthology (volume 2), music texts & graphics (1967-2003)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Includes Barkin's BAB's O, Milton Babbitt's Groupwise, and Conversations.

did.unittitle: Review of Phillip Ramey's Irving Fine
Review of Hollis Taylor's Post Impressions

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Consists of drafts, notes, biographical information, and correspondence from composers relating to entries written by Barkin for various editions of the Grove Dictionary of Music. Some copies of Barkin's published entries, correspondence from Grove, and a contract are also present. Entries include Milton Babbitt, Allan Blank, David Burge, Roger Goeb, Donald Martino, James K. Randall, Henry Weinberg, Peter Westergaard, and Charles Whittenberg.

did.unittitle: Pitch-time Structure in Arnold Schoenberg's Opus 23, No. 1: A Contribution Toward A Theory of Nontonal Music (dissertation)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Includes dissertation copy, scores, and critique.

did.unittitle: Subseries 2. Audible Traces: Gender, Identity, & Music

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Consists of material relating to publication of Audible Traces, co-edited by Barkin and Lydia Hamessley, published by Carciofoli Verlagshaus, 1999. Material includes drafts of Barkin's preface and Hamessley's introduction, contracts, and correspondence with authors and the publisher. Also included is a zip disk of material for the project (box 31).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Barkin served on the Executive Board and the Program Committee for the Society for Music Theory. Material includes correspondence, minutes, membership and program material, and a newsletter. Also present is Barkin's 1993 presentation Rules of One's Own, given to the SMT's Committee on the Status of Women, which also appeared in Audible Traces and e: an anthology.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: While at UCLA, Barkin was involved in the UC-wide New Music in Bali project, which promoted the creation of new works for gamelan and sponsored visiting composers from Bali. Barkin also received funding to travel to Bali, and conducted interviews with composers and musicians from 1988 to 1990. Material includes interview transcripts, items regarding the UC Pacific Rim Research Program, and correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence and contracts from the Association for the Promotion of New Music; Boelke-Bomart, Inc. & Mobart Music Publications, Inc.; and Composers Recordings, Inc.

did.unittitle: Subseries 6. American Society of University Composers Newsletter

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Primarily contains programs, flyers, and other ephemera concerning performances of Barkin's music and professional activities. Some related correspondence and clippings are also included. Items are filed in rough chronological order (reverse order within some folders).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Two CDs of jpg images of Barkin's hub cap masks, created 2002-2005.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Consists of letters received from colleagues and friends, primarily fellow composers. Barkin arranged her correspondence in rough chronological order (some folders are in reverse order).

did.unittitle: Correspondence and subject file: Diamanda Galás

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Includes Barkin's lecture "Notes for Diamanda Galás and her Plague Mass" given at UCLA October 1993.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Contains recordings of Barkin's works in various formats, including reels (5 inch and 7 inch), CDs, and audio cassettes. Dates are those of recording.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Most likely a 16 mm copy of James Whitney's 1966 experimental film Lapis. UCLA Film and Television Archives holds another copy.
